articles.title: Explore innovative, practical solar energy solutions for J&K: Satish Sharma
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent SRINAGAR, Sept 18: In a bid to accelerate the Government’s renewable energy initiatives, Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs, Information Technology, Transport, Youth Services and Sports, Satish Sharma today paid a surprise visit to ‘Tawanai Ghar’ of the Science & Technology (S&T) Department at Bemina here and took stock of its functioning. During the visit, the Minister directed the concerned officers to explore innovative and practical solar energy solutions that could be implemented across Jammu and […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
SRINAGAR, Sept 18: In a bid to accelerate the Government’s renewable energy initiatives, Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs, Information Technology, Transport, Youth Services and Sports, Satish Sharma today p... [1601 chars]

articles.title: IIIM Incubator receives ‘Bharat Incubator Award 2025’
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Sept 18: The Technology Business Incubator (TBI) of CSIR-Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine (CSIR-IIIM), Jammu, has been conferred with the ‘Bharat Incubator Award 2025’ at the 4th Bharat Entrepreneurship Summit held at the NDMC Convention Centre, New Delhi. The Bharat Entrepreneurship Summit is a flagship event every year organized by the Entrepreneurs Association of India (EAI). This national-level recognition highlights the IIIM incubator’s outstanding contributions towards fostering innovation, supporting startups, and promoting entrepreneurship in the Jammu & […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Sept 18: The Technology Business Incubator (TBI) of CSIR-Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine (CSIR-IIIM), Jammu, has been conferred with the ‘Bharat Incubator Award 2025’ at the 4th Bharat Entrepreneurship Summit h... [1850 chars]

articles.title: IUST conducts Board of Governors meeting
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent AWANTIPORA, Sept 18: The Islamic University of Science and Technology (IUST) held the second Board of Governors meeting of the DST-i TBI CIED IUST Foundation under the Chairmanship of Prof Shakil Ahmad Romshoo, Vice Chancellor, IUST. Prof Romshoo said that IUST has played a significant role in building the capacities of youth across Jammu and Kashmir, with more than 10,000 young people, including a large number of women, benefitting from its programs. He added that the university’s 600 […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
AWANTIPORA, Sept 18: The Islamic University of Science and Technology (IUST) held the second Board of Governors meeting of the DST-i TBI CIED IUST Foundation under the Chairmanship of Prof Shakil Ahmad Romshoo, Vice Chancellor... [1844 chars]

articles.title: Why is Rahul upset if percentage of votes has soared, asks Shelar
articles.description: Kolhapur: Information technology and cultural affairs minister Ashish Shelar hit back at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday, dismissing his \"vot.
articles.content: Kolhapur: Information technology and cultural affairs minister Ashish Shelar hit back at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday, dismissing his "vote chori" claims with sharp sarcasm and questioning his discomfort over rising voter turnout. "If mor... [1694 chars]

articles.title: Plasto launches new unbreakable bucket, mug
articles.description: r c plasto tanks and pipes pvt ltd, a leading brand in india for high-quality plastic tanks, pipes, and household products, launched its latest ‘plasto bucket and mug.’ these new products have been designed with advanced technology and top-quality standards, keeping in mind the everyday needs of customers. the features of new products consists as follows: they are made from 100 per cent virgin food-grade plastic completely safe and health-friendly. equipped with uv protection technology, ensuring no damage
articles.content:
Business Reporter :
Built with high quality, attractive design, and durability, these products are crafted to meet the essential needs of every home

articles.title: Students lay siege to RTMNU V-C for 5 hours over ‘Carry on’ issue
articles.description: to press the demand of implementing ‘carry on’, the students pursuing course of pharmacy laid siege at the office of vice-chancellor (v-c) of rashtrasant tukadoji maharaj nagpur university (rtmnu) on thursday. following the 5 hours drama, v-c dr madhavi khode-chaware could leave the office at jamnalal bajaj bhavan at 10.30 pm. pro-vice-chancellor dr subhash kondawar, registrar dr raju hiwase, dean of science and technology dr umesh palikundwar and some other officers reached ambazari police station to lodge
articles.content:
Staff Reporter :
To press the demand of implementing ‘Carry on’, the students pursuing course of Pharmacy laid siege at the office of Vice-Chancellor (V-C) of Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University (RTMNU) on Thursday. Following the 5 hours d... [2039 chars]
